availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James A. Johnson (Caldwell County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Caldwell County, Kentucky, farmer. Tennessee native. Married to Mary Johnson. Father of Martha Johnson, Miles Johnson, Katherine Johnson, Linn Johnson, and Sarah Johnson. Farmer in Caldwell County, Kentucky in 1850. Farmer in Caldwell County in 1860. Owned four enslaved individuals in Caldwell County in 1850. Owned twenty-four enslaved individuals in Caldwell County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, District 2, p. 397B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, District 2 , p. 20.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Princeton, p. 25.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Princeton, p. 28.
